translated: But if it is the first jhÄna, then insight is ordinary. If it is the second jhÄna, then insight is associated with the virtue of the surmounting of applied thought. He can then determine the jhÄna in the path as without applied thought. The same method applies in the case of the remaining jhÄnas as bases. This is the theory of the bases. When there is a jhÄna as a basis, the jhÄna in the path is of the same kind. But when there is not, the first jhÄna is in the path. The intention is this: the person who is familiar with that jhÄna or with jhÄna in general is unable to determine the jhÄna factors in the path. When there is a jhÄna as a basis, then whichever jhÄna he comprehends, if it is the first jhÄna, then insight is ordinary. If it is the second jhÄna, then insight is associated with the virtue of the surmounting of applied thought. He can then determine the jhÄna in the path as without applied thought. The same method applies in the case of the remaining jhÄnas comprehended. This is the theory of comprehension. When there is no jhÄna as a basis, then whichever jhÄna he comprehends as object for insight, if it is the first jhÄna, then insight is ordinary. If it is the second jhÄna, then insight is associated with the virtue of the surmounting of applied thought. He can then determine the jhÄna in the path as without applied thought. The same method applies in the case of the remaining jhÄnas comprehended. This is the theory of comprehension.

translated: Now, showing the unprofitable aggregates, he said â€œDelusionâ€ . Herein, he deludes , thus it is delusion . Or alternatively, beings are deluded by this , thus it is delusion . Or alternatively, delusion is mere delusion , just as eye is mere eye , and so on. It is said to be the blinding of cognizance by concealing the whole of the profitable side. But when it has reached the unprofitable side it should be regarded as having the mode of knowledge , since it is called â€œwrong knowledgeâ€ in the texts and in the commentaries it is said to be delusion occurring by the mode of thinking of a means for evil-doing . And ignorance is said to have a twofold state as non-performance and wrong performance. Herein, non-performance is simply non-knowing of the profitable side, and wrong performance is simply wrong knowledge of the unprofitable side. For it is said in the texts, â€œWhat is ignorance? It is non-knowing of suffering, non-knowing of the origin of suffering, non-knowing of the cessation of suffering, and non-knowing of the way leading to the cessation of sufferingâ€ , and in the commentaries it is said to be delusion occurring by the mode of thinking of a means for evil-doing. And it is said in the texts, â€œWhat is wrong knowledge? It is knowledge of sensual desires, knowledge of ill will, knowledge of cruelty, knowledge of whatever other unprofitable ideas there areâ€ .

translated: Now, showing the unprofitable aggregates, he said â€œDelusionâ€ . Herein, he deludes , thus it is delusion . Or alternatively, beings are deluded by this , thus it is delusion . Or alternatively, delusion is mere delusion , just as eye is mere eye , and so on. It is said to be the blinding of cognizance by concealing the whole of the profitable side. But when it has reached the unprofitable side it should be regarded as having the mode of knowledge , for in the texts it is called â€œwrong knowledgeâ€ . And in the commentaries it is said that â€œwrong knowledgeâ€ is delusion occurring as the thinking of a means in the case of evil-doing . And ignorance is said to have a twofold state as non-performance and wrong performance . Herein, non-performance is simply non-knowing of the profitable side, and wrong performance is simply wrong knowledge of the unprofitable side. For thus, when it has reached the unprofitable side, the five ideas have the mode of knowledge , namely, delusion, greed, false view, applied thought, and sustained thought. With cognizance

translated: Here the sixfold analysis should be stated. The first kind of faith, etc., in the cognitive series is called â€œeye-contact-born faith,â€ etc., because it is the first faith, etc., in the eye door. translated: The aggregates that are the objects of the four kinds of clinging are called clinging-aggregates . All states, whether subject to cankers or not, are called the five aggregates, according to the method of the analytical exposition of the aggregates . But only those subject to cankers are called the five aggregates subject to clinging, according to the method of the direct-knowledge exposition. They are called bases because they are the bases for the arising of their respective kinds of consciousness, and because they are the bases for the maintenance of individual existence. The word â€œbaseâ€ is used in the sense of birthplace in the case of the six internal bases, which are states occurring among the aggregates; in the sense of a place of resort, in the case of the six external bases, which are objects; and in the sense of a source, in the case of both, since they are the source of the arising of consciousness. Herein, the states of consciousness and its concomitants are born only in the six bases beginning with the eye, either in one birth in the course of a single existence or in the course of the beginningless round of rebirths, and nowhere else. And though they dwell in continuity, they dwell only in those same bases.

translated: and rebirth-linking, life-continuum, and death are. True. But here in the Root Commentary it is said: â€œThe kamma is a condition for the states occurring when it has been done by way of its being stored up, not by way of object. And it is a condition by way of object by way of mere object, not by way of distinguishing the continuity and by way of producing the fruit called kamma condition. Therefore, because of the difference in the modes of conditionality, they do not coincide, and so they are distinguished. But there is conascence, predominance, and presence condition. Support condition is threefold: conascence, prenascence, and prenascence as object. Herein, the first two are presence condition, but the last is in two of the object conditions. If it is weighty, it is also a decisive support condition. Preceding condition is threefold: preceding as object, preceding as physical basis, and preceding as object and physical basis. Herein, that which is preceding as physical basis is a condition by way of support for the states that arise in the physical basis. That which is preceding as object is a condition by way of object for the states that arise in the physical basis. That which is preceding as object and physical basis is a condition by way of object and by way of support for the states that arise in the physical basis. That which is preceding as object and physical basis is a condition by way of object and by way of support for the states that arise in the physical basis.

translated: In-breath and out-breath are called â€œin-breathings and out-breathings.â€ It â€œmeltsâ€ , â€œdissolvesâ€ , thus it is â€œloving-kindnessâ€ .
